summary: This is an incident report detailing the discovery of Jeffrey Epstein unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York on August 10, 2019. It describes the timeline of events from the discovery to his death at the hospital, and notes the presence of bruising and an improvised noose.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, pronounced dead at the hospital.

events.title: Discovery of Epstein Unresponsive and Death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at approximately 6:33 a.m. Staff initiated life-saving measures and he was transported to Health Services and then a local hospital, where he was pronounced dead at 7:36 a.m.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the MCC New York on August 10, 2019, at approximately 6:33 a.m.
He was pronounced dead at a local hospital at 7:36 a.m. on the same day.
Institution medical staff observed 'circumfricial bruising around the neck' and an 'orange make shift noose' was found in his cell.
